intro: Ruellia placoidea, commonly known as the narrowleaf ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple, depending on the species. Ruellia placoidea is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or open habitats. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade.
